title.narrative: PROTECTION OP 1 ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2023, policy and institutional frameworks that protect children from of violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage are strengthened, which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys in Madagascar, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected from violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and child marriage

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, policy and institutional frameworks that protect children from of violence, exploitation, abuse, neglect and childmarriage are strengthened

description.narrative: Revision of the decree establishing the National Child Protection Committee was started and the establishment and/or functioning of 245 child protection networks at district (47) and municipality (198) levels was supported. The programme on alternative measures to detentionwas expanded. The proportion of children in pretrial detention decreased but remains higher than in 2019. A mapping of the social service workforce is being finalized. Legal decrees related to adoption and foster care were finalised and are pending adoption. The government’s written replies to the list of issues of the Committee on the Rights of the Child were submitted in November. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
